items.name: Bally-tom
items.description: Rotund, slow-swimming fish with silver scales and bulbous green eyes
items.catch_notes: When threatened, their eyes flash hypnotically. The party member with the lowest Wisdom must Save Versus Hold or be dazzled and fall splashing into the water.

items.name: Braithgilly
items.description: Lithe, white-scaled trout with adorable pink eyes
items.catch_notes: When unafraid, braithgillies poke their heads above the surface and sing beautiful, wistful melodies. According to folklore, braithgillies willingly leap into the net of a maiden who sings to them under the light of the moon.

items.name: Butter-eel
items.description: 3′-long, buttery-brown eels with startled, gaping mouths and a tendency to writhe vigorously when caught
items.catch_notes: Butter-eels are coated with a fatty slime, making them difficult to land, requiring at least two PCs make a successful Dexterity Check.

items.name: Gaffer
items.description: Foot-long catfish with tufts of coarse white fur around their face and gills, often formed into a goat-like beard upon the chin
items.catch_notes: Bleat when dragged from the water.

items.name: Giant catfish
items.description: A real monster! Predatory fish 9–14′ long that attack anything nearby when hungry

consumption_effect.description: Massive fish providing 4 rations per Hit Point of the slain creature

items.catch_notes: Handle as a normal combat encounter. Spawn in the deeps of the Groaning Loch, but sometimes swim in other lakes and rivers.

items.name: Groper
items.description: Flat-bodied, green-skinned bottom feeders with gaping mouths and spacious gullets
items.catch_notes: There is a 2-in-6 chance of finding a random human trinket in a fish's belly.

items.name: Gurney
items.description: Big, ball-shaped fish with beady eyes, misshapen faces, and wide, flapping mouths
items.catch_notes: Known among anglers for their habit of suddenly snapping with their concealed rows of vicious, spiny teeth. Characters who have not caught gurneys before must Save Versus Doom or suffer 1 point of damage.

items.name: Hameth sprat
items.description: Little black-scaled fish with long, ribbon tails

consumption_effect.description: Small fish eaten whole, bones and all, typically fried in batter
consumption_effect.yield_note: A catch of hameth sprats only provides 2d4 rations

items.catch_notes: Flit around in great swarms, especially numerous in the River Hameth.

items.name: Lardfish
items.description: Head-sized, translucent cream jellyfish with tangled tentacles dotted with clusters of grape-like nodules
items.taste: Body is tough and fatty; tentacles are sweet and succulent

items.name: Maid-o'-the-lake
items.description: Thigh-sized, pink, translucent squids renowned as a Dolmenwood delicacy
items.taste: Succulent with a mildly fruity flavour
items.catch_notes: According to folklore, feasting beneath the moon on these squids fried in garlic butter is a sure way to summon the attentions of a witch, who will visit in the dead of night.

items.name: Mummer
items.description: Sluggish, puffy fish with mud-brown scales, pink, ribbon-like fins, and bulbous, yellow faces of an unnervingly human-like cast
items.catch_notes: There is a 3-in-6 chance that the face of one of the caught fish has an uncanny resemblance to a family member of someone in the party.

items.name: Nag-pike
items.description: Muscular, 3′-long, snaggle-toothed pikes with nine crooked horns upon their heads
items.taste: When sliced and fried, deliciously gamy
items.catch_notes: Nag-pikes are vicious and tenacious, making them tricky to catch. The catch is only landed if at least two PCs make a successful Strength Check.

items.name: Orbling
items.description: Silvery, spherical jellyfish that hide in weeds during the day and only emerge after sundown
items.taste: Outer skin is rubbery, insides are soft and taste of toffee

consumption_effect.description: Jellyfish eaten like boiled eggs, by slicing off the top and scooping out the insides

items.catch_notes: In shaded waters, they bob near the surface, resembling reflected moonlight.

items.name: Pilgrim crab
items.description: Chunky violet crabs with long, delicate pincers and creamy-white underbellies
items.catch_notes: Their shells are graven with lines that look curiously like a religious script (sometimes used for fortune-telling). If cooked alive, pilgrim crabs emit a shrill tone reminiscent of choirboys at practice.

items.name: Puffer
items.description: 2′-round, near-spherical fish covered with hard scales and spines

consumption_effect.description: Fresh pufferfish providing sustenance if properly prepared

items.catch_notes: Puffers are slow moving and easy to catch. Killing and preparing them is the tricky part: they have a gas-filled organ that explodes if not handled correctly. Characters who have not caught puffers before must Save Versus Blast or suffer 1d3 damage when the fish explode.

items.name: Queen's salmon
items.description: Iridescent-scaled salmon that dart and leap playfully
items.catch_notes: Queen's salmon are fairy fish that visit Dolmenwood to spawn. They speak Sylvan and basic Woldish, and address anglers in squeaking little voices when caught. In return for their lives, they offer to place their blessing upon the noble anglers. If released, each member of the fishing party gains a +4 bonus to the next Saving Throw rolled against a deadly effect (death, petrification, poison, etc.).

items.name: Screaming jenny
items.description: Long, slender fish with frilly purple fins and tails
items.catch_notes: When pulled from the water, they emit a startling shriek, which has a 3-in-6 chance of attracting a wandering monster.

items.name: Smuggler-fish
items.description: Puffed up, putrid green fish with lemon yellow bellies and wide, astonished eyes
items.catch_notes: Sigh plaintively then give up the ghost when landed. There is a 2-in-6 chance of finding a small gem (1d20 × 10gp) in the belly of one of the caught fish.

items.name: Twine-eel
items.description: 3′-long, twisty, finger-thick eels with scales of purple or burnished pink

consumption_effect.description: Fresh eel providing sustenance; fiddly to prepare due to fine bones

items.catch_notes: Swim in great schools and voraciously attack small prey and tempting morsels of bait.

items.name: Wraithfish
items.description: Lazy weed-browsers with near-transparent, jelly-like, white flesh
items.catch_notes: Wraithfish can turn incorporeal for brief periods, a trick they invariably perform when yanked out of the water by anglers. Madcap pipe music stymies this ability, and woodgrues are expert wraithfish catchers. Parties fishing without the requisite musical accompaniment only land fish sufficient for 1d6 rations.

_metadata.extraction_note: Fish species from the Fishing tables (d20). Catch effects happen during fishing, not consumption. Most fish are simply rations when consumed.
